title: 110_s1769
content: The "Same Number Act of 2007" is cited as the short title. It introduces number portability in voice services under the Communications Act of 1934. The Same Number Act of 2007 mandates that voice service providers must offer number portability as per Commission requirements, including establishing performance standards within 270 days to facilitate consumer choice among providers. The FCC must establish performance standards for data sharing during number porting and encourage automation. Different standards may apply based on provider classes to avoid excessive compliance costs. The Commission must make timeframes accessible to the public on its website. The FCC will establish number portability performance standards for voice service providers, who must report annually on their porting activity, including failed ports and explanations. The Commission will also submit an annual report to the Senate. The FCC will designate impartial entities to administer numbering for voice services and ensure equitable availability. The Commission will submit an annual report to Congress on the effectiveness of number portability standards, which will expire after 60 months. The FCC will designate impartial entities to administer numbering for voice services and ensure equitable availability. Costs for numbering administration and number portability will be shared by voice service providers. 9-1-1 will be designated as the universal emergency telephone number for reporting emergencies in the United States.
